Similar to dplyr's `glimpse()`, `str()` is in base R's utilities to display objects.

After loading glimpse via library(dplyr) mtcars can be used in the examples below.

![](images/str.png)

as you can see the format is a little different, but useful both ways. Try both the next time you need to view an object.

More info on str() is here: <https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/utils/versions/3.6.2/topics/str>
